Please make tt ranked permanent.

So, I talked to some of our lead game design guys, and I have a funny anecdote which explains why we can't make ranked TT permanent. Because the queue was available all the time, there were some times late at night when SO few people were playing it that two teams could just queue up and feed each other wins to boost each other straight to the top of the ladder. It was so dead, and so few people were playing it, that they could actually queue up in the general population and get matches against each other reliably all the time. 

So, honestly, the ranked ladder on TT wasn't worth anything because so few people were there that it was being taken over by cheaters. Making it a scheduled queue solves this.

I'm going to ask this again, **please** do not remove TT. 2 permanent maps is going to kill the diversity League offers. 

I'm a hardcore Dominion main (as my icon portrays). I haven't gotten over your decision to remove Dominion and I don't think I will if you remove TT as well.

Dominion was my 2nd (and a very close 2nd) home and it was taken away from myself and many other Dominion mains. An icon does NOTHING to compensate the time and effort we've put into Dominion and ultimately bring back the memories and the amazing times the Dominion community experienced.

Twisted Treeline was my 3rd home, it's now my 2nd home due to the removal of Dominion. I still haven't gotten over Dominion being removed and I really, really don't want to know how I would feel if my now 2nd home is removed (again).

I don't play on the Howling Abyss, it's not a home for me and will not replace TT. 

#Please on behalf of the Twisted Treeline community, we sincerely ask you to retain our home and our place in League.

As an avid treeline player most of my games are on that map now unless I am playing with other people. I will actually quit playing if treeline is removed to the RGM I have spent countless hours dedicated to learning and mastering treeline to the point that I have played with some famous league summoners in a few games Meteos being one of them. As for the reason that treeline has such a small community Riot you only have yourself to blame on that. 3's has always been restricted to either normals or team ranked we donlt get any of the cool features like draft pick in normals or being able to go solo in ranked, and because of that there is no real draw of new players to the game mode it just exists.  I have even had people I know try out treeline for the first time after they hit 30 never played it before because there is literally no promotion of the mode and they couldn't believe that there was such an interesting and different way to play league.  Riot I beg don't get rid of this game mode it means a lot to us treeline players.

As someone who has played a lot of ranked 3's in the middle of the night, I have to say that I still disagree. I think your reasoning is good, but honestly still kills it. I think you're hurting more than you're helping. Just my humble opinion, but ranked 3's doesn't even mean that much. Having someone boost doesn't bother me at all vs someone who would be found boosting in solo queue. It's a way fun game mode and I miss it, dang it! Besides, finding the same team twice in a row sometimes was a good rematch :)

Ranked 3's and Dominion (which we all know the fate of) is the only reason I kept playing for the last nearly 3 years.

Summoners rift isn't fun.  Playing with randoms isn't fun.  Blue-side advantage isn't fun.  The playtime of the mode isn't fun.

Plain and simple 5's isn't fun.

Dominion - that was fun.
Ranked 3's was tough, but it was fun.

ARAM was novel - but now it's boring and it doesn't teach you anything.  There is no mode to just go and learn a champion anymore.  

"Go play 5's" ... yeah right ... take an unlearned champion into 5's ... I've learned that lesson a long time ago.  Even in normals it's beyond painful.  Between the harassment of team-mates and the fact that you get to suck for 40 minutes as you learn the champion ... yeah ... no thanks ...

Dominion was the perfect learning ground.
Threes is fast and fun and competetive.

Both of them are dying or have died because you refused to support them and then cited your lack of support as "why they need to die"

This is almost entirely due to under-support by Riot and the unfortunate focus on SR, which, while occasionally fun, many people view as just a game-mode and not a complete game. Riot seems to play lip-service to this when many people are pretty bored with it. 

This is where all of the calls for new game modes being made permanent came from (hello "give us URF back!" crowd) and constant frustration with the player-bleed due to no support for Dominion and Treeline. Hell I know a guy who quit when he found out Magma Chamber was officially scrapped. 

My suspicion is that Riot/Ten-Cent's sustainability plans simply involve appealing to new players as they age-in to target age-bracket rather than trying to expand demographic appeal through new modes. Which makes a certain amount of sense given market-saturation in the field. 

Why I don't understand is why, instead of doing belabored maintenance on supposedly dying game-modes they don't try to reinvigorate them through promotion? Why not have official tournaments or rewards for the mode? A lot of irregulars logged into Dominion queue when it was announced it was being shuttered simply to see if they could get that icon(despite it being fairly clear from the announcement that that wasn't an option)! Or maybe a segment on unofficial tourneys by professionals for Prime Time League? Or pro-play events being broadcast by the Esports team?

I'm not saying any of this would necessarily work, and it's totally possible that a mode can die and people who haven't give up will be disappointed. It's just extremely frustrating to see a mode die to Riot seemingly not caring about the mode. 

Saying that a mode is shrinking and maybe should have been a rotating mode both ignores it's history(it was popular enough to warrant a map-rework at one point!) and becomes a self-fulfilling prophecy. Because who wants to put in the time to learn a mode that is apparently slated for the chopping block?

It's saying to the Treeline populace "beatings will continue until morale improves". Going to be hard to keep them coming back. Just as it was with Dominion.

I just wanna be able to play the bilgewater map on aram again, there doesn't seem to be a reason to not have it. It would be nice if it could be implemented somehow all year round

Why would they have it back? It's functionally identical to the normal ARAM map, and splitting the population of that game mode for entirely superficial reasons would be a dumb move, not to mention that not enough people agree with you to make it worth changing the entire map permanently; I'm personally very fond of the Murder Bridge, for example. 

Also, if they bring back any superficial change to one of the maps, I'd like the seasonal changes to Summoner's Rift to come back, but Rito has stated that they don't plan on doing anything like that again. 
Your best bet is to download a client-side mod to change the visuals of the game on your end.

He wasn't saying make a new gamemode just because he thought Aram wasn't good enough. He was saying that it would be cool if they could switch out how it looked every once in a while like they did with bilgewater.
